page.title: 16WARNDON MOTORWAY DIVISION 1
page.content: {EMPLOYMENT}-On a bad winter's day normally, the weather forecast is sent from the met' office in Birmingham, then the forecast is broadcasted on CB radio to the county road department from there, men check the roads between three and four in the morning and the duty of the foreman decides whether to grit the roads or not. The men are split into six divisions who are always on standby. On the motorway the men work twelve hour shifts. The men come on at 7.30am till 7.30pm and then another group of men work from 7.30pm till 7.30am.Twenty six men work in this division. {ROAD SURFACES}-The days when there is snow on the roads, they put salt on the road to melt the snow. Although the salt on the road is doing good it is damaging the road surface,also frost damages the surface.
